content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as the central storage depot.
- Stone Furnace at position (x=-3.0, y=19.0) used for smelting iron ore into iron plates.
- Stone Furnace at position (x=-4.0, y=21.0) employed for copper smelting to produce copper plates.

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System)
Consists of the following entities:
- Lab at position (x=-7.5, y=18.5) configured for automation research.
- Boiler at position (x=-5.5, y=24.0) which has been refueled with coal.
- Generator (Steam Engine) at position (x=-0.5, y=24.5) that generated high energy (≈14958.33) after boiler refuel but later is observed with 0.0 energy.
- Offshore Pump at position (x=-7.5, y=25.5) operating normally.
- Electricity Group comprising:
   • Small electric poles at positions (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), and (x=3.5, y=19.5)
   • Newly added small electric pole at position (x=1.5, y=22.5) placed in Step 167 to enhance local power supply.
- Pipe Groups forming the fluid network:
   • PipeGroup (fluid_system=3824) at position (x=-10.5, y=16.5) – EMPTY.
   • PipeGroup (fluid_system=3825) at position (x=-12.5, y=18.5) – EMPTY.
   • PipeGroup (fluid_system=3827) at position (x=-8.5, y=20.5) – FULL_OUTPUT.
   • PipeGroup (fluid_system=3829) at position (x=-2.5, y=21.5) – EMPTY.

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- AssemblingMachine1 at position (x=1.5, y=19.5) operating the copper-cable recipe. Despite several manual copper plate transfers and recipe resets, it continues to report warnings: ["not receiving electricity", "cannot create copper-cable due to missing resources: copper-plate (1)"] and shows an energy level of 0.0.
- Burner Inserter at position (x=1.5, y=17.5) refueled with coal yet still waiting for source items.
- Input Chest at position (x=1.5, y=16.5) designated to receive copper plates.
- Output Chest at position (x=1.5, y=21.5) for dispatching copper-cable.
- Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at position (x=-5.5, y=21.5) holding copper plates.
Note: Multiple manual transfers—from furnace to buffer chest and then to the input chest—and a forced direct power connection have been attempted to resolve resource and electrical issues, but the copper-plate shortage and lack of power at AssemblingMachine1 persist.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Fuel and Resource Management:
   - Maintain sufficient coal and raw materials; confirm that smelting operations fully supply copper plates before initiating transfers.
• Entity Placement & Collision Avoidance:
   - Verify that the target positions for placement (such as for small electric poles) are unoccupied; adjust spacing or change directions when placement conflicts occur.
• API and Variable Usage:
   - Ensure that all entity references are valid and non-nil before using them in operations (for example, when force-connecting power between the steam engine and AssemblingMachine1).
• Power Connectivity:
   - Review and validate power network connections; if a direct connection attempt fails, recheck setup and wiring to ensure robust electrical routing.
• Supply Chain Coordination:
   - Synchronize resource transfers so that automated inserters and assembling machines receive materials without requiring repeated manual intervention.
